titleStmt.title: Letter, T.J. Wharton to David Burford, 1841 Aug. 18

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, T.J. Wharton to David Burford,

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: You have learned before this that I arrived here a few days ago. It was my intention to visit you as soon as I got up in order to fill an appointment made with Johnston & to arrange the terms of compromise between the him and yourself. But visiting with Col Guild & having a consultation in reference to all the matters in controversy, he stated that he was in suspicion of my visit, concurred in them & would see you at Your Court. That it was therefore unnecessary for me to go up. If there be any this further that you wish to comminicate, write early as I shall leave as soon after the 10th such as possible. I learn from my Brother lrlow that a letter was recd. from you after I left home. He expected that I would see you & did not speak of the contents of the letter
